required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on December 16, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Pharmacokinetic Study of a Fixed Dose Combination Nefopam Hydrochloride (30 mg) / Paracetamol (500 mg)
clinical_study.official_title: Pharmacokinetic Study of a Fixed Dose Combination Nefopam Hydrochloride (30 mg) / Paracetamol (500 mg) and Individual Nefopam Hydrochloride and Paracetamol Taken Alone or Concomitantly After Oral Single Dose

brief_summary.textblock: This study aims to assess the pharmacokinetic profile of a Fixed Dose Combination nefopam hydrochloride (30 mg) / paracetamol (500 mg) and individual components taken alone or concomitantly after oral single dose.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: An open-label, randomized, four-period, four treatments, cross-over trial in healthy volunteers

primary_outcome.measure: Nefopam and Paracetamol Pharmacokinetic profiles in each arms after single dose
primary_outcome.description: Peak Plasma Concentration (Cmax) of nefopam hydrochloride and paracetamol after single dose at different timepoints : Within 60 min before drug administration),0.25, 0.5, 0.75, 1, 1.25, 1.5, 2, 2.5, 3, 3.5, 4, 5, 6, 8, 12, 16, 24, 36 and 48 hours

primary_outcome.measure: Nefopam and Paracetamol Pharmacokinetic profiles in each arms after single dose
primary_outcome.description: Area under the plasma concentration versus time curve (AUC) of nefopam hydrochloride and paracetamol after single dose at different timepoints : Within 60 min before drug administration),0.25, 0.5, 0.75, 1, 1.25, 1.5, 2, 2.5, 3, 3.5, 4, 5, 6, 8, 12, 16, 24, 36 and 48 hours

secondary_outcome.measure: Paracetamol metabolites Pharmacokinetic profiles in each arms after single dose
secondary_outcome.description: Peak Plasma Concentration (Cmax) of main paracetamol metabolites (Sulfate and Glucuronide) after single dose at different timepoints : Within 60 min before drug administration),0.25, 0.5, 0.75, 1, 1.25, 1.5, 2, 2.5, 3, 3.5, 4, 5, 6, 8, 12, 16, 24, 36 and 48 hours

secondary_outcome.measure: Paracetamol metabolites Pharmacokinetic profiles in each arms after single dose
secondary_outcome.description: Area under the plasma concentration versus time curve (AUC) of main paracetamol metabolites (Sulfate and Glucuronide) after single dose at different timepoints : Within 60 min before drug administration),0.25, 0.5, 0.75, 1, 1.25, 1.5, 2, 2.5, 3, 3.5, 4, 5, 6, 8, 12, 16, 24, 36 and 48 hours

secondary_outcome.measure: N-desmethyl-nefopam Pharmacokinetic profiles in each arms after single dose
secondary_outcome.description: Peak Plasma Concentration (Cmax) of N-desmethyl-nefopam after single dose at different timepoints : Within 60 min before drug administration),0.25, 0.5, 0.75, 1, 1.25, 1.5, 2, 2.5, 3, 3.5, 4, 5, 6, 8, 12, 16, 24, 36 and 48 hours

secondary_outcome.measure: N-desmethyl-nefopam Pharmacokinetic profiles in each arms after single dose
secondary_outcome.description: Area under the plasma concentration versus time curve (AUC) of N-desmethyl-nefopam after single dose at different timepoints : Within 60 min before drug administration),0.25, 0.5, 0.75, 1, 1.25, 1.5, 2, 2.5, 3, 3.5, 4, 5, 6, 8, 12, 16, 24, 36 and 48 hours

secondary_outcome.measure: Incidence of Treatment-Emergent Adverse Events [Safety and Tolerability]
secondary_outcome.description: Occurrence and severity of adverse events (serious and non-serious adverse events)

intervention.intervention_name: Combination Product: nefopam hydrochloride 30mg / paracetamol 500mg X2
intervention.description: Combination Product: nefopam hydrochloride 30mg / paracetamol 500mg X2

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Male and non-pregnant female human subjects, age 18 - 45 years.
- Body Mass Index between 18.5-30 Kg / m2 .
- Subjects with normal findings .
- Willingness to follow the protocol requirements
Exclusion Criteria:
- Known history of hypersensitivity to Nefopam, Paracetamol or related drugs.
- Requiring medication for any ailment having enzyme-modifying activity in the previous 28 days, prior to dosing day.
- Subjects with a history of convulsive disorders.
- Subject with a moderate or severe renal impairment
- History of cardiovascular, renal, hepatic, ophthalmic, pulmonary, neurological, metabolic, haematological, gastrointestinal, endocrine, immunological or psychiatric diseases.
- Female subjects not confirming to using birth control measures,
